title: Why can Fiora block things that hit her from behind.
body: It makes absolutely no sense.  I understand why she can parry things coming from the side, but from behind. Really

It's like instant save-me-from-everything windwall.

I hate windwall.
I hate new riposte.

Windwall is balanced, blocks only projectiles, quite long cooldown, and laser ultimates can go through it. Also it stays in one place and does not provide any form of CC. It is on higher cooldown than projectile CC abilities so after you use it, you have to be cautious. Riposte is on lower cooldown than hard CC abilities, it can counter any and all forms of damage and CC, not only projectiles, but anything.  It also stuns you if you did any CC to her. It is actual bullshit.

Somewhat, {{champion:157}} 's windwall only blocks projectiles, nothing constant or anything that covers an area immediately. Like lux's ult, long range but does damage to the entire area of her ultimate immediately. Something like {{champion:420}} 's soul ripping tentacle, covers the area of the ability over time, that is what {{champion:157}} 's windwall blocks. However, fiora's riposte blocks anything and everything. Lux's ult? yup, Vel'koz's ult? Mhm, {{champion:57}} 's root? Yup. Fiora's riposte blocks any and all damage and CC from all angles, if she receives CC and hits a champion with her riposte projectile, she stuns them for 2 seconds. She blocks, ALL DAMAGE AND ALL CC FROM ANY AND ALL ANGLES, DOES NOT MATTER WHAT IT IS. On a 10-15 second cooldown. Talk about balance
